transcript: trying to do both is a great way to guarantee that neither will happen I was talking to a good investor friend of mine and he said I am convinced that most business growth does not happen because the founders are simply impatient and so because of that they make short-term decisions to split their attention they can never chase the one horse for long enough to let it compound if you do one thing for a very very long period of time you get very good at it and the problem is that no one can wait long enough
